title: Blade of the Ruined King isn't even bought on the only champions who used to buy it.
body:
Vayne, Kalista, Yi, Warwick, Shyvana, and more don't even consider this item anymore. Even against an HP tank like Mundo it's not even worth considering. It's absurdly expensive, provides no noteable powerspike, and doesn't scale with other items. It's active is very weak compared to other items such as ghostblade which in addition to having strong actives are still gold efficient. It's one of the least efficient offensive items in the entire game, coming in at a disgusting 73% gold efficiency without the passive. Even in extreme circumstances, the passive is not going to be doing enough damage to make up for the horrible stats. 

Most importantly, the champions who used to build this item are not as dominant as they were in this item's prime, before the nerf. It needs a reworked effect, new effect, price drop, or buff to the stats or passive. When a cookie cutter offensive item with no real niche is never purchased, it's obvious there's a huge issue with it's power or cost. It's not like a banshee's veil or Wit's end that is strong but rarely bought due to nice effects. It's an item nearly every AD champion in the game would consider buying if it wasn't so horribly overpriced. It's clear that the stats are the issue. We've gone more than an entire season without any champion even touching this item.

The active on blade of the ruined King isn't that weak and it feels like the main reason Vayne doesn't build BOTRK anymore is because her burst build has become a tad dominant. 

That aside it's stats are a bit too much of a one size fits all providing AD, on hit damage, life steal, and attack speed on top of a movement speed steal active which is still really good for kiting.

How does that "one size fits all" argument work when it would be waaay more effective to buy more cost efficient items that give different stats? Especially now that serker greaves give 35% AS, you start with doran's blade, and can receive more lifesteal from masteries, there's no reason to buy Botrk even for the balanced spread of stats.

All Botrk does right now is delay better builds. It causes more problems than it solves. Don't get me wrong, I like that it's got multiple stats instead of just being a glob of AD, but the horrible gold efficiency makes it undesirable. It could be a balanced spread of stats whilst being closer to 85% gold efficient and it would actually be a fair and decent item.
Well to put it mildly, when BOTRK is good it does become a one size fits all item. Here's a question, When blade of the ruined king is a good item why build {{item:3072}}?

BT scales with crit and has a far greater lifesteal whilst providing a shield for defense.

Botrk is in such a bad state because it's not meant to scale, it's meant to be a one item powerspike. In it's current state, it simply doesn't provide a powerspike at all. It's too expensive and gold inefficient to be a half decent option.

How does bloodthirster scale with crit and BOTRK doesn't? You've lost me there. Attack speed and AD both contribute to your overall DPS and the amount of damage output you deal with critical strikes. 

Blade of the ruined king gives 10% life steal while bloodthirster gives 20% which is quite a difference but then you factor in the damage both items bring to the table with bloodthirster providing a good 50 more AD while BOTRK provides 40% more attack speed and on hit damage. 

Finally the shield vs the active of blade of the ruined King. A shield active that increases your effective health in fights is very useful but versus an active that practically makes you untouchable to anyone who isn't range or borderline inescapable if they aren't mobile is far more useful than a basic shield given can save you from some situations.

If this item is buffed it will pretty much become an all purpose item. :l Item should be completely reworked rather than buffed.

I have two main issues with your statements:

* BotRK does scale with other items: attack speed lets you proc the passive damage more often, armor pen and shred makes the passive hit and active both hit harder, spirit visage makes the lifesteal more effective, deaths dance lets you heal from the passive procs and active effect, tank items indirectly scale the sustained damage from procs since you can survive longer in combat to get more autos off, items that slow like frozen mallet and randuins also indirectly scale by keeping enemies in range for you to auto them more, abilities and items which multiply your on hit effects like shyvanna q and bloodrazer scale up the amount of hits you get in, items that speed you up like boots and black cleaver let you stick longer and auto more, etc. There are many many interactions between items that make botrk more effective the more items you have. Saying BoTRK doesn't scale because it doesn't have an ad ratio attached to the passive or active is lazy thinking. The passive and active themselves already scale with enemy max hp even if you don't include the many ways items can make those effects hit harder or more often.

* This follows from the first point partially but BoTRK IS a niche item, not a generic damage item. It offers little ad and the lifestealing is inferior to what you'd get from most other items. What it offers is attack speed and on hit damage thaqt scales with enemy max hp. It is therefor not an item that most champions can efficiently buy and it is also an item that is most effective against tanky enemies who regen health rapidly (because by the % current health damage on autos does more damage if the enemy keeps increasing their current health). Champions who build tanky but also have auto attack resets or otherwise scale with attack speed can make good use of going botrk and full tank when facing enemy high hp regenerating tanks. It is a VERY niche item right now because it may be undertuned or it may not have common enemy to be used against in the current meta, but its still a niche item with a very specific set of champions who might use it and enemies it might be used against. That's what it means to be niche.
